thread.title: Controversial Chinese photographer Ren Hang dies aged 29 - 9news.com.au
thread.title_full: Controversial Chinese photographer Ren Hang dies aged 29 - 9news.com.au

title: Controversial Chinese photographer Ren Hang dies aged 29 - 9news.com.au
text:
Controversial Chinese photographer Ren Hang dies aged 29 By 9NEWS The photographer had a long history of depression. (Ren Hang) 
Chinese photographer Ren Hang, whose work often focussed on nudity and sexuality, has died aged 29. 
Hang rose to fame for his sexually charged and confronting photography style. 
A self-taught photographer, his images embraced block colours, nudity and spontaneity, and he once admitted he went into shoots with “no plans”, according to Time Magazine . 
Hang was arrested a number of times throughout his career in his home country of China, over the explicit nature of his photographs. 
Outdoor nudity and pornographic imagery were banned in the country in 1949. 
Despite this, Hang stood by the notion his work was not “taboo” or trying to “push boundaries”. 
https://www.instagram.com/p/BFZpLlfLY6a/ 
He was born in 1987 in Jilin, China, and became interested in photography in 2008, when he was studying marketing. 
Hang had a history of depression and wrote about this in poetry, notably in one poem called My Depression . 
In 2014 he wrote: “Life is indeed, a precious gift, but I often feel, it seems to send the wrong man”. 
At the time of his death, Hang was working on a solo exhibition to be shown at the Foam Museum in Amsterdam. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
